class.name: DistanceJoint3D
class.brief_description: A physics constraint which moves two bodies such that their distance is between a minimum and maximum distance.
class.description: A physics constraint which moves two bodies such that their distance is between a minimum and maximum distance. For example, "Body A" can be a [StaticBody3D] representing a ceiling while "Body B" can be a [RigidBody3D] representing a hanging chandelier which can swing when hit. [b]Note:[/b] This constraint is only supported by the Jolt Physics engine. To switch to Jolt Physics, set [member ProjectSettings.physics/3d/physics_engine] to [b]Jolt Physics[/b].

method.name: get_global_point
method.description: Returns the global position of the point specified.

method.name: get_param
method.description: Returns the value of the specified parameter.

method.name: get_point_param
method.description: Returns the local point on the [PhysicsBody3D] where the constraint is attached.

method.name: set_param
method.description: Sets the value of the specified parameter.

method.name: set_point_param
method.description: Sets the local point on the [PhysicsBody3D] where the constraint is attached.

members.member: The local point on Node A where the constraint is attached.
The local point on Node B where the constraint is attached.
The maximum distance between points A and B. If the distance between A and B exceeds [member distance/max] a spring will be used to move the points closer.
The minimum distance between points A and B. If the distance between A and B does not exceed [member distance/min] a spring will be used to move the points further apart.
The damping of the spring pulling the bodies together. (0 = no damping, 1 = critical damping). Set to zero if you don't want to pull the bodies together with a spring.
The strength of the spring pulling the bodies together. Increase this value to pull the bodies together faster. Set to zero if you don't want to pull the bodies together with a spring.

constants.constant: The strength of the spring pulling the bodies together. Increase this value to pull the bodies together faster. Set to zero if you don't want to pull the bodies together with a spring.
The damping of the spring pulling the bodies together. (0 = no damping, 1 = critical damping). Set to zero if you don't want to pull the bodies together with a spring.
The minimum distance of the constraint.
The maximum distance of the constraint.
Represents the size of the [enum Param] enum.
The point on Node A where the distance constraint is attached.
The point on Node B where the distance constraint is attached.
